plans.name: stp_snapshot
plans.description:
Moves devices for pressure and temperature (defaults fetched from the context)
    and captures a single frame from a collection of devices

    Args:
        detectors (List[Readable]): A list of devices to read while the sample is at STP
        temperature (Optional[Movable[float]]): A device controlling temperature of the
            sample, defaults to fetching a device name "sample_temperature" from the
            context
        pressure (Optional[Movable[float]]): A device controlling pressure on the
            sample, defaults to fetching a device name "sample_pressure" from the
            context
    Returns:
        MsgGenerator: Plan
    Yields:
        Iterator[MsgGenerator]: Bluesky messages

plans.name: count
plans.description:
Reads from a number of devices.
    Wraps bluesky.plans.count(det, num, delay, md=metadata) exposing only serializable
    parameters and metadata.

plans.name: spec_scan
plans.description:
Generic plan for reading `detectors` at every point of a ScanSpec `Spec`.
    A `Spec` is an N-dimensional path.

Circle_Reference_.description:
Mask contains points of axis within an xy circle of given radius.

.. example_spec::

    from scanspec.regions import Circle
    from scanspec.specs import Line

    grid = Line("y", 1, 3, 10) * ~Line("x", 0, 2, 10)
    spec = grid & Circle("x", "y", 1, 2, 0.9)

x_axis.description: The name matching the x axis of the spec
x_axis.title: X Axis

y_axis.description: The name matching the y axis of the spec
y_axis.title: Y Axis

x_middle.description: The central x point of the circle
x_middle.title: X Middle

y_middle.description: The central y point of the circle
y_middle.title: Y Middle

Circle_Reference_.title: Circle

CombinationOf_Reference_.description: Abstract baseclass for a combination of two regions, left and right.
CombinationOf_Reference_.title: CombinationOf

Concat_Reference_.description:
Concatenate two Specs together, running one after the other.

Each Dimension of left and right must contain the same axes. Typically
formed using `Spec.concat`.

.. example_spec::

    from scanspec.specs import Line

    spec = Line("x", 1, 3, 3).concat(Line("x", 4, 5, 5))

left.description: The left-hand Spec to Concat, midpoints will appear earlier

right.description: The right-hand Spec to Concat, midpoints will appear later

gap.description: If True, force a gap in the output at the join
gap.title: Gap

check_path_changes.description: If True path through scan will not be modified by squash
check_path_changes.title: Check Path Changes

Concat_Reference_.title: Concat

DifferenceOf_Reference_.description:
A point is in DifferenceOf(a, b) if in a and not in b.

Typically created with the ``-`` operator.

>>> r = Range("x", 0.5, 2.5) - Range("x", 1.5, 3.5)
>>> r.mask({"x": np.array([0, 1, 2, 3, 4])})
array([False,  True, False, False, False])
DifferenceOf_Reference_.title: DifferenceOf

Ellipse_Reference_.description:
Mask contains points of axis within an xy ellipse of given radius.

.. example_spec::

    from scanspec.regions import Ellipse
    from scanspec.specs import Line

    grid = Line("y", 3, 8, 10) * ~Line("x", 1 ,8, 10)
    spec = grid & Ellipse("x", "y", 5, 5, 2, 3, 75)

x_axis.description: The name matching the x axis of the spec
x_axis.title: X Axis

y_axis.description: The name matching the y axis of the spec
y_axis.title: Y Axis

x_middle.description: The central x point of the ellipse
x_middle.title: X Middle

y_middle.description: The central y point of the ellipse
y_middle.title: Y Middle

x_radius.description: The radius along the x axis of the ellipse
x_radius.title: X Radius

y_radius.description: The radius along the y axis of the ellipse
y_radius.title: Y Radius

Ellipse_Reference_.title: Ellipse

IntersectionOf_Reference_.description:
A point is in IntersectionOf(a, b) if in both a and b.

Typically created with the ``&`` operator.

>>> r = Range("x", 0.5, 2.5) & Range("x", 1.5, 3.5)
>>> r.mask({"x": np.array([0, 1, 2, 3, 4])})
array([False, False,  True, False, False])
IntersectionOf_Reference_.title: IntersectionOf

Line_Reference_.description:
Linearly spaced frames with start and stop as first and last midpoints.

.. example_spec::

    from scanspec.specs import Line

    spec = Line("x", 1, 2, 5)

axis.description: An identifier for what to move
axis.title: Axis

start.description: Midpoint of the first point of the line
start.title: Start

stop.description: Midpoint of the last point of the line
stop.title: Stop

Line_Reference_.title: Line

Mask_Reference_.description:
Restrict Spec to only midpoints that fall inside the given Region.

Typically created with the ``&`` operator. It also pushes down the
``& | ^ -`` operators to its `Region` to avoid the need for brackets on
combinations of Regions.

If a Region spans multiple Frames objects, they will be squashed together.

.. example_spec::

    from scanspec.regions import Circle
    from scanspec.specs import Line

    spec = Line("y", 1, 3, 3) * Line("x", 3, 5, 5) & Circle("x", "y", 4, 2, 1.2)

See Also: `why-squash-can-change-path`

spec.description: The Spec containing the source midpoints

region.description: The Region that midpoints will be inside

check_path_changes.description: If True path through scan will not be modified by squash
check_path_changes.title: Check Path Changes

Mask_Reference_.title: Mask

Polygon_Reference_.description:
Mask contains points of axis within a rotated xy polygon.

.. example_spec::

    from scanspec.regions import Polygon
    from scanspec.specs import Line

    grid = Line("y", 3, 8, 10) * ~Line("x", 1 ,8, 10)
    spec = grid & Polygon("x", "y", [1.0, 6.0, 8.0, 2.0], [4.0, 10.0, 6.0, 1.0])

x_axis.description: The name matching the x axis of the spec
x_axis.title: X Axis

y_axis.description: The name matching the y axis of the spec
y_axis.title: Y Axis

x_verts.description: The Nx1 x coordinates of the polygons vertices
x_verts.title: X Verts

y_verts.description: The Nx1 y coordinates of the polygons vertices
y_verts.title: Y Verts

Polygon_Reference_.title: Polygon

Product_Reference_.description:
Outer product of two Specs, nesting inner within outer.

This means that inner will run in its entirety at each point in outer.

.. example_spec::

    from scanspec.specs import Line

    spec = Line("y", 1, 2, 3) * Line("x", 3, 4, 12)
Product_Reference_.title: Product

Range_Reference_.description:
Mask contains points of axis >= min and <= max.

>>> r = Range("x", 1, 2)
>>> r.mask({"x": np.array([0, 1, 2, 3, 4])})
array([False,  True,  True, False, False])

axis.description: The name matching the axis to mask in spec
axis.title: Axis

min.description: The minimum inclusive value in the region
min.title: Min

max.description: The minimum inclusive value in the region
max.title: Max

Range_Reference_.title: Range

Rectangle_Reference_.description:
Mask contains points of axis within a rotated xy rectangle.

.. example_spec::

    from scanspec.regions import Rectangle
    from scanspec.specs import Line

    grid = Line("y", 1, 3, 10) * ~Line("x", 0, 2, 10)
    spec = grid & Rectangle("x", "y", 0, 1.1, 1.5, 2.1, 30)

x_axis.description: The name matching the x axis of the spec
x_axis.title: X Axis

y_axis.description: The name matching the y axis of the spec
y_axis.title: Y Axis

x_min.description: Minimum inclusive x value in the region
x_min.title: X Min

y_min.description: Minimum inclusive y value in the region
y_min.title: Y Min

x_max.description: Maximum inclusive x value in the region
x_max.title: X Max

y_max.description: Maximum inclusive y value in the region
y_max.title: Y Max

angle.description: Clockwise rotation angle of the rectangle
angle.title: Angle

Rectangle_Reference_.title: Rectangle

Repeat_Reference_.description:
Repeat an empty frame num times.

Can be used on the outside of a scan to repeat the same scan many times.

.. example_spec::

    from scanspec.specs import Line

    spec = 2 * ~Line.bounded("x", 3, 4, 1)

If you want snaked axes to have no gap between iterations you can do:

.. example_spec::

    from scanspec.specs import Line, Repeat

    spec = Repeat(2, gap=False) * ~Line.bounded("x", 3, 4, 1)

.. note:: There is no turnaround arrow at x=4

gap.description: If False and the slowest of the stack of Frames is snaked then the end and start of consecutive iterations of Spec will have no gap
gap.title: Gap

Repeat_Reference_.title: Repeat

Snake_Reference_.description:
Run the Spec in reverse on every other iteration when nested.

Typically created with the ``~`` operator.

.. example_spec::

    from scanspec.specs import Line

    spec = Line("y", 1, 3, 3) * ~Line("x", 3, 5, 5)

spec.description: The Spec to run in reverse every other iteration

Snake_Reference_.title: Snake

Spiral_Reference_.description:
Archimedean spiral of "x_axis" and "y_axis".

Starts at centre point ("x_start", "y_start") with angle "rotate". Produces
"num" points in a spiral spanning width of "x_range" and height of "y_range"

.. example_spec::

    from scanspec.specs import Spiral

    spec = Spiral("x", "y", 1, 5, 10, 50, 30)

x_axis.description: An identifier for what to move for x
x_axis.title: X Axis

y_axis.description: An identifier for what to move for y
y_axis.title: Y Axis

rotate.description: How much to rotate the angle of the spiral
rotate.title: Rotate

Spiral_Reference_.title: Spiral

Squash_Reference_.description:
Squash a stack of Frames together into a single expanded Frames object.

See Also:
    `why-squash-can-change-path`

.. example_spec::

    from scanspec.specs import Line, Squash

    spec = Squash(Line("y", 1, 2, 3) * Line("x", 0, 1, 4))

spec.description: The Spec to squash the dimensions of

check_path_changes.description: If True path through scan will not be modified by squash
check_path_changes.title: Check Path Changes

Squash_Reference_.title: Squash

Static_Reference_.description:
A static frame, repeated num times, with axis at value.

Can be used to set axis=value at every point in a scan.

.. example_spec::

    from scanspec.specs import Line, Static

    spec = Line("y", 1, 2, 3).zip(Static("x", 3))

axis.description: An identifier for what to move
axis.title: Axis

Static_Reference_.title: Static

SymmetricDifferenceOf_Reference_.description:
A point is in SymmetricDifferenceOf(a, b) if in either a or b, but not both.

Typically created with the ``^`` operator.

>>> r = Range("x", 0.5, 2.5) ^ Range("x", 1.5, 3.5)
>>> r.mask({"x": np.array([0, 1, 2, 3, 4])})
array([False,  True, False,  True, False])
SymmetricDifferenceOf_Reference_.title: SymmetricDifferenceOf

UnionOf_Reference_.description:
A point is in UnionOf(a, b) if in either a or b.

Typically created with the ``|`` operator

>>> r = Range("x", 0.5, 2.5) | Range("x", 1.5, 3.5)
>>> r.mask({"x": np.array([0, 1, 2, 3, 4])})
array([False,  True,  True,  True, False])
UnionOf_Reference_.title: UnionOf

Zip_Reference_.description:
Run two Specs in parallel, merging their midpoints together.

Typically formed using `Spec.zip`.

Stacks of Frames are merged by:

- If right creates a stack of a single Frames object of size 1, expand it to
  the size of the fastest Frames object created by left
- Merge individual Frames objects together from fastest to slowest

This means that Zipping a Spec producing stack [l2, l1] with a Spec
producing stack [r1] will assert len(l1)==len(r1), and produce
stack [l2, l1.zip(r1)].

.. example_spec::

    from scanspec.specs import Line

    spec = Line("z", 1, 2, 3) * Line("y", 3, 4, 5).zip(Line("x", 4, 5, 5))

left.description: The left-hand Spec to Zip, will appear earlier in axes

right.description: The right-hand Spec to Zip, will appear later in axes

Zip_Reference_.title: Zip

plans.name: set_absolute
plans.description:
Set a device, wrapper for `bp.abs_set`.

    Args:
        movable (Movable[T]): The device to set
        value (T): The new value
        group (Group | None, optional): The message group to associate with the
                                           setting, for sequencing. Defaults to None.
        wait (bool, optional): The group should wait until all setting is complete
                               (e.g. a motor has finished moving). Defaults to False.

    Returns:
        MsgGenerator: Plan

    Yields:
        Iterator[MsgGenerator]: Bluesky messages

plans.name: set_relative
plans.description:
Change a device, wrapper for `bp.rel_set`.

    Args:
        movable (Movable): The device to set
        value (T): The new value
        group (Group | None, optional): The message group to associate with the
                                           setting, for sequencing. Defaults to None.
        wait (bool, optional): The group should wait until all setting is complete
                               (e.g. a motor has finished moving). Defaults to False.

    Returns:
        MsgGenerator: Plan

    Yields:
        Iterator[MsgGenerator]: Bluesky messages

plans.name: move
plans.description:
Move a device, wrapper for `bp.mv`.

    Args:
        moves (Mapping[Movable, T]): Mapping of Movables to target positions
        group (Group | None, optional): The message group to associate with the
                                           setting, for sequencing. Defaults to None.

    Returns:
        MsgGenerator: Plan

    Yields:
        Iterator[MsgGenerator]: Bluesky messages

plans.name: move_relative
plans.description:
Move a device relative to its current position, wrapper for `bp.mvr`.

    Args:
        moves (Mapping[Movable, T]): Mapping of Movables to target deltas
        group (Group | None, optional): The message group to associate with the
                                           setting, for sequencing. Defaults to None.

    Returns:
        MsgGenerator: Plan

    Yields:
        Iterator[MsgGenerator]: Bluesky messages

plans.name: sleep
plans.description:
Suspend all action for a given time, wrapper for `bp.sleep`

    Args:
        time (float): Time to wait in seconds

    Returns:
        MsgGenerator: Plan

    Yields:
        Iterator[MsgGenerator]: Bluesky messages

plans.name: wait
plans.description:
Wait for a group status to complete, wrapper for `bp.wait`.
    Does not expose move_on, as when used as a stub will not fail on Timeout.

    Args:
        group (Group | None, optional): The name of the group to wait for, defaults
                                           to None, in which case waits for all
                                           groups that have not yet been awaited.
        timeout (float | None, default=None): a timeout in seconds


    Returns:
        MsgGenerator: Plan

    Yields:
        Iterator[MsgGenerator]: Bluesky messages
